summary: the pathogen of porcine epidemic diarrhea virus (PEDV) is a highly contagious enteric disease of swine, characterized by watery diarrhea, which results in high morbidity in pigs all of ages and mortality in piglets. since the first report in 1978 (13), there have been frequent outbreaks in many swine-raising countries, leading to severe economic losses in Asia, notably in China, Thailand, and Korea. two specific monoclonal antibodies (MAbs) against PEDV were developed and characterized. an antigen capture ELISA (AC-ELISA) method was established using one of the MAbs to detect PEDV in fecal samples.
